channel.title: My TiddlyWiki
channel.description: a reusable non-linear personal web notebook

item.title: Getting Started
item.description:
Set up Git repository

1) Visit http://github.com and register for a free account
2) Add your SSH key to the account (learn more http://github.com/guides/providing-your-ssh-key )
3) Create a new repository, let's call it "tiddlycollab" and set the description and url to whatever you like

Local setup

1) Install Git if you have not already
2) Configure Git
git config --global user.email YOUREMAIL@DOMAIN.COM

Begin use of repo

open command line
Folow git hub next steps:
mkdir tiddlycollab cd tiddlycollab git init touch README git add README git commit -m 'first commit' git remote add origin git@github.com:opensciinfo/tiddlycollab.git git push origin master


Visit http://www.tiddlywiki.com/ to download a blank copy of TiddlyWiki and save it to this directory

git add empty.html
or
git add .

git commit -m 'blank tiddlywiki'
git push origin master


copy empty.html to tiddlycollab.html

cp empty.html tiddlycollab.html

git add tiddlycollab.html
or
git add .

git commit -m 'began tiddly collab tutorial'
git push origin master


open tiddlycollab.html in a browser
do some editing
save to repository

git commit -m 'began writing tiddly collab tutorial'
git push origin master
